keyword: calories in one pound of chicken breast
title: Calories in One Pound of Chicken Breast
meta_description: Discover calories in one pound of chicken breast, including protein, fat, carbs breakdown per 100 g basis, totals, and preparation tweaks for accurate tracking.
h1: Calories in One Pound of Chicken Breast
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken breast, cooked (roasted or grilled), no sauce/oil added; 1 pound â‰ˆ 454 g.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, cut, cooking method, seasoning, water content, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One pound of cooked, skinless chicken breast provides ~749 kcal and ~141 g protein.

label_note: Totals are scaled from the per-100 g basis and mirror Nutrition Facts fields.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g
Breaded and fried (vs. grilled) per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in one pound of cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Approximately 749 kcal for skinless, boneless, cooked without added fats.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one pound of chicken breast?
faqs.a: About 141 g of protein, making it a high-protein option.

faqs.q: Are these calories for raw or cooked chicken breast?
faqs.a: Cooked weight; raw would be higher due to water loss during cooking.

faqs.q: How does skin affect calories in chicken breast?
faqs.a: Skin-on adds ~30 kcal per 100 g, increasing total to ~885 kcal per pound.

faqs.q: What are the macros per 100 g of chicken breast?
faqs.a: 165 kcal, 31 g protein, 3.6 g fat, 0 g carbs per 100 g cooked skinless.
